qas.question: Under which agreement are Detroit's major newspapers published?
When was The Metro Times founded?
In what year did Detroit's two major newspapers reduce home delivery?

context: The Detroit Free Press and The Detroit News are the major daily newspapers, both broadsheet publications published together under a joint operating agreement called the <a0_0>Detroit Newspaper Partnership<a0_0/>. Media philanthropy includes the Detroit Free Press high school journalism program and the Old Newsboys' Goodfellow Fund of Detroit. In March <a2_0>2009<a2_0/>, the two newspapers reduced home delivery to three days a week, print reduced newsstand issues of the papers on non-delivery days and focus resources on Internet-based news delivery. The Metro Times, founded in <a1_0>1980<a1_0/>, is a weekly publication, covering news, arts & entertainment.
